result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Dechante M Nelson
Current: 2918 A  North 55th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 05-04-2022)
Prior: 2918 North 55th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210

Defendant Dechante M Nelson in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. * for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/04/2022@01:30pm
